skillTree.localised_description: Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The last desperate act of the warriors of Clan Verms is to fling the larva they have helped raise at their foes in the hopes it will delay them enough for the Skaven to escape.
When as poor as Clan Verms is, you turn over every stone looking for treasure.
Once a great trading clan, the instincts that led them to profit in those days still remain.
High-pitched squeeks fill the night as a darkling cloud pours forth.
The noise rats make as they gnaw at the ankles can be quite unpleasant. Especially for those they are chewing upon.
Once again, the wormoil lanterns of Clan Verms light the path through the dark.
When dumped across a foe, the potent mixture of spidersilk and wormoil pins a foe, and makes him oh so easy to set alight.

ui_effects.localised_text: Applies +50% Flame Weakness and -48% Speed on contact
Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: Constantly covered by hatchlings and other small vermin that they are nursing, warriors of Clan Verms fling such creatures at their foes when forced to enter combat.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Spider Hatchlings

skillTree.localised_description: The deafening peals toll throughout the land, driving the verminous Skaven to ever-greater heights of ferocity.
Whether by attachment or mutation, something nasty and spiky on your tail has got to bring no little advantage in battle.
As you might expect, the forces of order are repelled by the Skaven and their myriad disgusting, disease-ridden ways.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dwarfs
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Lizardmen
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against High Elves, Lizardmen, Dwarfs and men

skillTree.localised_description: Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.

ui_effects.localised_text: Explosion does not affect friendly troops

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
One of the last few precious magical weapons from their heyday, these wormoil enchanted blades burn with a heat fixed in place by warpstone and foul magics.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Vermin must have fathers, yes-yes!

effects.description:
Leadership: +2 for Lamplighter and Verminkeeper units

skillTree.localised_description: Spinning webs of silent doom hang from darkened shadows above their prey.

Speed: +12% for Giant Spider, Spider Hatchling, and Arachnarok units

skillTree.localised_description: Let the vermin get in close. Smart rats fight from range!

Ammunition: +15% for Scuttler and Wormoil Slinger units

skillTree.localised_description: Bred to be even more poisonous than their desert-dwelling cousins, the scorpions of the Under-Empire are a potent weapon in Clan Verms' arsenal.

effects.description:
Armour: +5 for Scorpion and Giant Scorpion units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +10 for Scorpion and Giant Scorpion units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +5% for Scorpion and Giant Scorpion units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +15 for Scorpion and Giant Scorpion units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Bountiful swarms of rats fill every nook and cranny of the breeding hives, and fight when drive to it by their Skaven overseers.

	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Rat Swarm and Giant Rat units
	(Lord's army)

Physical Resist: +10% for Rat Swarm and Giant Rat units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +8 for Rat Swarm and Giant Rat units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: From on high in the darkness of the caves comes the shrieking bats, stunning enemies with distracting shouts.

effects.description:

Speed: +15% for Fly, Bat, and Giant Bat units

skillTree.localised_description: Covered in swarming armour, these are the elite of the elite amongst the armoured forces of Clan Verms.

effects.description:
Magic Resist: +20% for Lamplighter and Verminkeeper units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs Large: +8 for Lamplighter and Verminkeeper units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: From the shadows of the Under-Empire flies spattering fire and sticky strands.

effects.description:
Reload time reduction: +10% for Scuttler and Wormoil Slinger units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +10% for Scuttler and Wormoil Slinger units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: A clacking, chittering, swarming carpet of vermin, belched forth from the Breeding Hives.

	(Lord's army)

Missile Resist: +12% for Scorpion and Spider units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Running simply brings the vermin coming quicker, for they sense the fear in their prey

effects.description:
Ward save: 10% for Bat, Rat, and Fly units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: 15% for Bat, Rat, and Fly units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
Keeping on top of things with an iron fist prevents Skavendom from becoming too much of a degenerate mess.
Naturally, rats get in everywhere  even the tiniest opening presents little obstacle  spreading their disease and corruption everywhere they can.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
When making corpses of your foes, leave nothing of value for their kin to recover.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

factionEffects.localised_description: Reviled for their past, Clan Verms clings to the production of wormoil and the breeding of verminous creatios, the only things they have left in a harsh world

effects.description: Access to the Breeding Hives to recruit verminous units
Capturing Skaven capital cities reduces the cost and upkeep of non-Verms units

Upkeep: +300% for all non-Verms units
	(all armies)

Recruitment cost: +300% for all non-Verms units
	(all armies)
Construction cost: +300% for all non-Verms military buildings

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Blight Tenscratch made a play for power and led his clan to ruin. Now, left with the shattered remains of his hopes and dreams, he seeks to piece together what was once a thriving empire.

effects.description:
Gain following for 3 turns after declaring war on a Skaven faction:
	  Ambush success chance: +25% (all armies)
	  Replenishment Rate: 15% (all units)
	  Charge Bonus: +8 (all units)
	  Clan Verms recruitment cost: -50%
	(Lord's army)

Leadership and Melee Attack: +1 for Clan Verms for each active war against Skaven
	(factionwide)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: While it might not be palatable, the vermin of Clan Verms are edible in a pinch.
